episodeTitle: Silver Fox Foxy! The Merciless Interference!
episodeTitleJapanese: 銀ギツネのフォクシー！猛烈妨害攻勢
episodeTitleRomanized: Gin Gitsune no Fokushī! Mōretsu bōgai kōsei!
description: The Donut Race reaches its climax as Foxy reveals his Devil Fruit powers for the first time, using the Noro Noro no Mi to slow down the Straw Hats' boat and secure victory. Chopper is chosen as the prize, and the second event, Groggy Ring, is introduced with Zoro and Sanji facing a disadvantage.

events.title: Final Stretch of the Donut Race
events.description: With only three boats remaining in the Donut Race - Luffy's, Nami's, and Porche's - the race enters its final phase as the contestants navigate through obstacles including coral reefs and whirlpools.
events.significance: Sets up the climactic conclusion of the first Davy Back Fight event.

events.title: Foxy Reveals the Noro Noro no Mi
events.description: Foxy uses his Devil Fruit powers for the first time in the series, firing Noro Noro Beams that slow down the Straw Hats' boat and anything they hit for thirty seconds, demonstrating the power of the Slow-Slow Fruit.
events.significance: First appearance of the Noro Noro no Mi Devil Fruit ability in the anime, establishing Foxy as a Devil Fruit user and explaining his success in Davy Back Fights.

quotes.speaker: Foxy
quotes.context: Foxy's first use of his Devil Fruit power

events.title: Noro Noro Beam Debut
events.description: Foxy demonstrates the primary ability of the Noro Noro no Mi by firing purple beams of Noroma Photons that slow down objects and people for thirty seconds, giving him a decisive advantage in the race.
events.significance: Introduction of Foxy's signature technique that will be used throughout the Davy Back Fight.

events.title: Foxy Pirates Win the Donut Race
events.description: Using his Noro Noro powers to slow down the Straw Hats at the crucial moment, Foxy ensures that Porche's boat crosses the finish line first, giving the Foxy Pirates victory in the first round of the Davy Back Fight.
events.significance: First loss for the Straw Hats in the Davy Back Fight, putting them at risk of losing a crew member.

events.title: Chopper Chosen by Foxy Pirates
events.description: After winning the Donut Race, Porche selects Tony Tony Chopper as the prize, forcing him to temporarily join the Foxy Pirates. Chopper is devastated but must follow the rules of the Davy Back Fight.
events.significance: Major emotional moment as the Straw Hats lose their doctor, raising the stakes for the remaining events.

quotes.speaker: Porche
quotes.context: Porche selecting Chopper as the prize for winning the race

events.title: Groggy Ring Rules Explained
events.description: Foxy explains the second event of the Davy Back Fight, the Groggy Ring, a brutal ball game where one player on each team serves as the ball that must be thrown through the opponent's ring.
events.significance: Introduces the rules of the next Davy Back Fight event and sets up the disadvantage the Straw Hats will face.

events.title: Groggy Monsters Introduction
events.description: Foxy introduces his elite combat team, the Groggy Monsters, consisting of Hamburg, Pickles, and Big Pan, who will compete in the Groggy Ring event.
events.significance: Introduction of the Straw Hats' opponents for the second event.

events.title: Zoro and Sanji Face 3-on-2 Disadvantage
events.description: Because Chopper was supposed to participate in the Groggy Ring but is now on the Foxy Pirates, and the Straw Hats cannot change their pre-declared lineup, only Zoro and Sanji will compete against the three Groggy Monsters.
events.significance: Establishes the handicap the Straw Hats face in the next event, testing Zoro and Sanji's teamwork despite their rivalry.

quotes.speaker: Foxy
quotes.context: Foxy using his Devil Fruit power for the first time

quotes.speaker: Porche
quotes.context: Selecting Chopper as the prize after winning the Donut Race

themes.description: Foxy's use of underhanded tactics and his Devil Fruit powers to cheat in the Davy Back Fight demonstrates how not all pirates fight with honor.
themes.symbolism: The Noro Noro no Mi represents how time manipulation and deception can overcome raw strength.

themes.description: The forced separation of Chopper from the Straw Hats highlights how deeply the crew values each member and their determination to get him back.
themes.symbolism: Chopper's reluctant departure emphasizes the strength of the bonds formed within the Straw Hat crew.

themes.description: The setup for the Groggy Ring forces Zoro and Sanji, who constantly bicker, to work together against overwhelming odds.
themes.symbolism: The disadvantage represents how adversity can force rivals to cooperate.

characterSpotlights.development: Foxy reveals his true threat level by demonstrating his Noro Noro no Mi powers, showing why he has won 920 Davy Back Fights previously.
keyActions: Uses Noro Noro Beam for the first time
Ensures Porche's victory in the Donut Race

characterSpotlights.role: Victim of the Davy Back Fight
characterSpotlights.development: Chopper experiences the painful separation from his crew, showing his deep attachment to the Straw Hats.
keyActions: Is selected as the prize by Porche

characterSpotlights.development: Zoro is set up to face overwhelming odds alongside Sanji in the next event.
keyActions: Prepares to participate in the Groggy Ring with only Sanji as backup

characterSpotlights.development: Sanji must work with his rival Zoro despite being outnumbered.
keyActions: Prepares to face the Groggy Monsters with Zoro

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime significantly expanded the Donut Race with additional boats and participants. In the manga, the race was much shorter and simpler.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first appearance of the Noro Noro no Mi Devil Fruit in the anime, one of the most unique Paramecia-type fruits with time manipulation abilities.
The episode received an 11.0% TV rating in Japan, ranking 7th for the week it aired.
The Groggy Monsters are themed after sandwich ingredients - Hamburg (hamburger), Pickles, and Big Pan (bread in Japanese).
